pr_title: Add readonly check while delete recursively

timeline.message: add readonly check while delete recursively

timeline.bodyText: How is this different from the check below? https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/pull/11513/files#diff-7f82122f923de058e3c4a20b43cd7e4eR1565
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: The check below won't check descendants of the path, it just check the path itself
replies.author: tinkerrrr

replies.bodyText: I see. Would checking only the descendant mount points work? I am concerned that checking every path may be unnecessarily expensive, especially for a large sub-tree of the namespace.
replies.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: We already check the permissions of every file and directory when deleting recursively. I don't think this would make much of a difference
replies.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: I thought it was unnecessary to check the same mount point multiple times. Also, checkUnderWritableMountPoint() calls getMountPoint(), and that needs to iterate over all the mount points to find the longest prefix.
replies.author: gpang

replies.bodyText:
We already check the permissions of every file and directory when deleting recursively. I don't think this would make much of a difference

Well, I've updated the use-case in my first comment. As it described, the scenario is, a user with the right permission did this operation, the should-be-protected sub-directory was delete unexpectedly
replies.author: tinkerrrr

replies.bodyText:
I thought it was unnecessary to check the same mount point multiple times. Also, checkUnderWritableMountPoint() calls getMountPoint(), and that needs to iterate over all the mount points to find the longest prefix.

Thanks for your advice! I think checking only the descendant mount points works
replies.author: tinkerrrr
